ArticleTitle.sentence: Interleukin-12 expression in B cells by transformation with Epstein-Barr virus.

AbstractText.sentence: Although interleukin (IL)-12 was originally purified from an Epstein-Barr (EBV)-transformed B cell line and the high correlation of EBV infection and IL-12 expression has been suggested, no study has reported whether EBV infection is directly linked to IL-12 expression.

AbstractText.sentence: To address this issue, we have investigated IL-12 expression in B cells during in vitro transformation with EBV.

AbstractText.sentence: Human peripheral B cells became capable of constitutively producing p40 by in vitro transformation with EBV, coincident with the expression of latent membrane protein 1 (LMP1) of EBV.

AbstractText.sentence: These B cells expressed p40 and p35 mRNA, and phorbol myristate acetate (PMA) stimulation strongly enhanced p40 and p70 production.

AbstractText.sentence: Furthermore, transfection with LMP1 expression vector into a human B lymphoma cell line, Daudi, led to p40 production with nuclear factor (NF)-kappaB activation.
